# Introduction

This is a book created from markdown and executable code.

See @Kruschke2015DBDA for additional discussion of literate programming.

::: {#cell-fig-standard-normal .cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import scipy.stats

xs = np.linspace(-5, 5, num=500, endpoint=False)
ys = scipy.stats.norm.pdf(x=xs, loc=0.0, scale=1)
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(2.8, 2.8))
ax.plot(xs, ys, lw=2, c="gray")
ax.set_xlabel(f"$x$")
ax.set_ylabel(f"$p(x)$")
ax.set_aspect("auto")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
```
